stream_context.summary: Kaze continues grey-box work on Course 14’s cardboard-and-pencil area, placing new ‘bump’ enemies, spikes, and deciding where to hide the 8-bit retro pipe. He discusses memory optimisation that removes the Expansion Pak requirement, brainstorms the Mario Paint retro minigame, and reviews overall project progress (Course 14 nearly done, Course 15 half done). Naming and visual plans for the Ice Castle (Course 15) are also debated.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 geometry enlarged to improve camera and remove a triple-jump skip.
development_findings.quote: The area needed to be bigger for the sake of the camera.

development_findings.summary: Instant warps and collision maps are postponed until the full level re-work to avoid wasted effort.
development_findings.quote: I'm not gonna make the area fully playable until the rework is done.

development_findings.summary: ‘Bump’ enemies (cardboard pencils with googly eyes) added; Kaze fixes snapping bug caused by eye-gravity flag.
development_findings.quote: They also snap back when they move in the end, which I really hate, but I don't know why […] Oh, it's because of the eye gravity thing here.

development_findings.summary: New spike obstacles modelled as pencil tips; polygon count confirmed acceptable for N64.
development_findings.quote: Wouldn't the spikes be too many polygons? – Nope. If they were, I wouldn't be doing this.

development_findings.summary: Debated rollable bridge placement for Yoshi coin and pipe access; finally moves retro pipe onto a high cardboard platform that requires wing-cap.
development_findings.quote: I think the bit pipe would be perfect on here. This is an easily visible location that's kind of hard to get to.

development_findings.summary: Old ROM-hack tools forced Expansion Pak usage; Kaze’s optimised source removes that need for new hacks.
development_findings.quote: You don't even need my optimised source code to make a ROM hack run without the Expansion Pack.

development_findings.summary: Overall schedule: all main courses expected finished in 2025; only three side levels and three overworld parts remain after current work.
development_findings.quote: We’re almost done with Course 14 and Course 15 is also already halfway done […] we’re definitely gonna finish all the main content in 2025.

development_findings.summary: Course re-work status listed: Courses 1, 3, 4, 5, 11 re-done; Ice Castle outside area still awaiting Zeina’s pass.

Retro section brainstorming: rejects Mario Paint platforming, settles on Mario Paint drawing minigame with dotted outline of Mario, 124×124 canvas, colour pickup pads, ground-pound fill and pixel-matching scoring.
development_findings.quote: Once you’ve drawn Mario close enough you’ll get a new star.

development_findings.summary: Fallback considered: Dr Mario pill-fall platformer if Mario Paint proves unworkable.

context_findings.summary: Kaze moved from Germany to Canada in 2021 and expresses frustration with German politics and bureaucracy.
context_findings.quote: I moved to Canada because I needed to flee Germany. Germany fucking sucks.

context_findings.summary: He accepts a sponsored two-hour Roblox stream for $135, showing pragmatic approach to funding.
context_findings.quote: $135 for two hours— that’s like almost $70 an hour to play Roblox.

context_findings.summary: Nostalgic anecdote: stopped watching wrestling as a child when he learned it was scripted, reflecting early emphasis on authenticity.
context_findings.quote: I stopped watching wrestling when I found out it's fake.

context_findings.summary: Seeks dramatic ‘WWE-style’ live election coverage, hinting at his taste for playful spectacle.
context_findings.quote: I want the full WWE excitement bullshit experience.

biobak.summary: Will receive the grey-boxed Course 14 area to add final colours and textures.
biobak.quote: This is what we're gonna send off to Biobak and he’s gonna make the colors pretty.

biobak.summary: Lighthearted language exchange: his messages forced Kaze to learn a bit of French.
biobak.quote: You just made me involuntarily learn French.

zeina.summary: Responsible for outside section of Ice Castle but lost PC internet when new router was installed; Kaze plans to revert setup after stream.
zeina.quote: You have no internet in your PC, the guy fucked it up. Well after the stream we're just gonna set the internet back, no problem.

zeina.summary: Brief personal joke about grooming, showing casual on-stream dynamic between Kaze and his wife.
zeina.quote: Zeina have you made sure to shave your balls? … I heard they stop as soon as you shave your balls.

key_stories.title: Shady Internet Swap
key_stories.summary: A door-to-door salesman offered cheaper internet without paperwork; 12 hours later a technician installed a router the company admits is ‘dog-shit’.
key_stories.challenge: Tempting but unclear offer of cheaper service with no contract.
key_stories.process: Kaze allowed installation but remained skeptical, learning from installer that the service is poor.
key_stories.outcome: Router works badly; Kaze plans to restore old setup after stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Now I don't know what to do— we have the router that by their own admittance is dog-shit.

key_stories.title: Roblox Sponsorship Decision
key_stories.summary: Kaze weighs up a paid Roblox stream offer and accepts because of the high hourly rate.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing indie passion project with income opportunities.
key_stories.process: Reads sponsor email on-stream, calculates pay, interacts with chat about game modes.
key_stories.outcome: Plans Sunday Roblox stream, exemplifying pragmatic funding.

key_stories.title: Expansion Pak Myth Busting
key_stories.summary: Viewers ask why hacks need the N64 Expansion Pak; Kaze explains historical tool limitations and his optimisation work.
key_stories.challenge: Community belief that advanced hacks must use extra RAM.
key_stories.process: Explains memory management, notes old tools were ‘lazy’.
key_stories.outcome: Confirms Return to Yoshi’s Island will run on base hardware.
key_stories.key_quote: Rom-hacks never needed the Expansion Pak— the tools were just programmed lazily.

open_questions.context: Kaze sketched rough design: dotted outline, colour pads, ground-pound fill, pixel-matching score but says coding flood-fill will be ‘difficult’.
questions: How will the flood-fill or ground-pound colouring be coded within N64 limits?

questions: What artistic direction is Biobak planning for the cardboard aesthetic?

open_questions.context: Zeina is slated to handle exterior visuals but has no internet and workload unclear.

open_questions.context: Kaze claims hacks can run on 4 MB; mentions ‘optimised source’ but no details.
